column6: I think Plans 1 and 3 are the least favorable of the plan options.
I think Plan 2 is the most favorable.
What you save in initial startup costs will be offset in years by the cost of waste disposal.
Plan 2 seems to be the best compromise with the budget.
Plan 4 is much too expensive.
While I think Plan 2 is the most economical, I don't think it's the best choice.
Wind power as a primary source of energy isn't reliable enough for a major city.
"5. The city has several large hospitals that need a stable and reliable energy source."
Their yearly budget is also 900M
Every plan outside of 1 goes over the yearly budget though
But plan 1 also pretty much violates everything they want
Only 40%.
They're going to go overbudget regardless.
Only 40% is a major amount.
Not to mention, "7. The city prefers energy sources whose cost is stable."
Plan 2 seems to hit the most requirements. I'm assuming the slight overbudget is okay, as they all are.
Wind power doesn't generate a stable energy cost due to it's fluctuation.
Not to mention, wind power will have a higher maintenance cost in the long run compared to hydroelectric power.
With a mix of all for energy sources though, there should be back up methods to using the others when needed.
can you please stop removing my comments and replacing them
I'm not doing it to your comments.
Then make them more accurate and word them better?
It's not the most cost effective plan
That's the coal plan
It's the most cost-effective of the greener plans
No it is not because the coal plan is less cost effective over time
Then the hydro is the most cost effective over a longer time
jesus christ
stop nitpicking me
and work on the task
Considering it's a team effort and anything you write is put in for everybody, I'd say it's important to do so.

column6: Any other ideas we can put in there?
Anything we can add as a benefit/risk to being a tourist city?
Well, using green energy means less pollution, and tourism is likely to decline if it's polluted.
We're going to get hit for "3. The city is a famous tourist city for its natural bird habitats."
